head.title: August 13-19; Law Firms Limit Aid to Poor

hedline.hl1: August 13-19; Law Firms Limit Aid to Poor

block.p: Despite record profits, many of the nation's biggest law firms have cut back on pro bono work so sharply that they now fall far below professional standards for representing people who cannot afford to pay. Flooded with business and pressed to bill more time to pay for rising salaries, lawyers at the top 100 firms now average 36 hours a year on pro bono cases, instead of the 50 hours urged by the American Bar Association.
